parsed.internal_thinking: My current resources are 2 Wood and 1 Sheep. Upon reviewing the game state, I cannot afford any actions at this moment. Building a road requires 1 Wood and 1 Brick, a settlement requires 1 Wood, 1 Brick, 1 Sheep, and 1 Wheat, and a development card requires 1 Ore, 1 Sheep, and 1 Wheat. I lack the necessary Brick, Wheat, and Ore to perform any of these actions. Furthermore, I do not possess 4 of any single resource to initiate a 4:1 bank trade, nor do I have any active 2:1 ports to leverage a more favorable trade. The `meta.dice` field is null, which indicates that the dice roll for my current turn has not yet occurred. Since 'roll_dice' is not an allowed action for me to select, the game system is expected to handle this automatically. However, until that automatic roll occurs and resources are distributed, my current resource pool is fixed. Given these constraints, I am unable to take any productive action on the board. Therefore, the most logical and appropriate action is to end my turn, passing the initiative to the next player. My strategic plan remains to expand towards the W2 port at Node 40 (from my settlement at Node 41, via road 41-40) and the B2 port at Node 7 (from Node 13, via roads 14-15 and 15-7). Both paths require accumulating Brick and Wood, which I will aim to do in subsequent turns once resources are collected.
parsed.note_to_self: Current resources: W:2, S:1. Still need Brick, Wheat, and Ore for expansion and dev cards. Priority is to build roads towards the W2 port at Node 40 and the B2 port at Node 7. My settlements are at Node 13 (W3, S5, S5) and Node 41 (O5, Wh9, B10), providing a good resource spread. Player B is focused on Ore; keep an eye on their expansion and resource accumulation, especially with their O2 port at Node 16. Next turn, after dice roll, assess resources for road building towards ports.
parsed.say_outloud: No moves for me this turn, just waiting for the dice to roll next time!
